title: recover my data after reseting password
content: My firefox account was logged out and while signing in i reset my password but whole previous data is deleted. Isn't there any way to recover that data ?
creator: kalpeshnalawade16

title: Firefox se queda colgado al abrir nueva pestaña y hacer una nueva búsqueda, aparece mensaje error
content:
Buenos días,

Soy informático en una empresa y me he topado con la siguiente problemática con el navegador que utiliza uno de los usuarios, al tener varias pestañas abiertas (3 o 4), al abrir una nueva y introducir alguna búsqueda esta se queda colgada y no carga, pudiendo dejarlo varios minutos sin que cargue la pagina o la búsqueda en Google. Además de que el resto de pestañas que ya tenia abiertas como que pierden la conexión. La solución que esta aplicando el usuario es cerrar el navegador volverlo a abrir y ya le carga correctamente. (hasta que le vuelve a pasar)

Aparte llega a mostrar un mensaje de error en algunas ocasiones, otras veces simplemente sale el mensaje conforme la pagina no a cargado o no muestra el mensaje se queda cargando indefinidamente.

Mensaje de error: ssl_error_handshake_unexpected_alert

Esto solo le ocurre con este navegador, con otros no tiene este problema.

Soluciones aplicadas:

- Limpieza de archivos temporales y registro. - Restauración del navegador a 0. (Restauración a fabrica de la configuración por defecto). - Desinstalar navegador borrando perfiles y volviéndolo a instalar y configurar. - Iniciar en modo seguro y verificar que no sea un problema de las extensiones o complementos. - Deshabilitar el aceleramiento de hardware. - Modificar configuración de Proxy. - Instalación de versión beta Nightly.

Después de aplicar esas soluciones y ver que la problemática se mantiene me encuentro en un punto muerto en el cual no se por donde avanzar o seguir haciendo pruebas.

Agradecer vuestra ayuda y soporte.
creator: carles.biayna

title: Jumping to first tab with key command Ctrl + 1 doesn't work
content:
Jumping to first tab with key command Ctrl + 1 doesn't work in Windows 10. I tested with different sites; deactivating extensions but I can only use Ctrl + 2 up to 8.

On Mac I can use CMD+1-9 and 0 for the last one.
creator: pejoh86

title: Pinch touchpad to zoom smoothly (like a touch-screen) instead of in discrete steps
content:
I use my laptop's touchpad for zooming but it acts just like Ctrl + "+" or Ctrl + "-" and changes the whole webpage. I want to zoom in smoothly so that only that part of the screen gets enlarged (like zooming an image on touchscreen). I looked on the internet and found that it can be done by turning "apz.allow_zooming" to true from about:config but it was already set to true. I use the latest Firefox version on Windows 10 on Lenovo Ideapad 330.

Currently, using the touchpad for zooming leads to slow increments in zooming (100%, 110%, etc.) but I don't want that because it makes a few websites inaccessible.
creator: yash.reserve.s

title: Any New Developments for Bookmark Thumbnail Image Viewing (like ViewMarks) in Firefox 64-bit
content:
Hello,

I was told that there would be a new feature in Firefox to allow viewing of bookmarks as thumbnail images of bookmarked pages. January was given as an ETA on that feature.

It looks like some of the functionality is already in Firefox as saving a bookmark create a miniature image of the page in the bookmark pop-up window. I did find it places that thumbnail image as a PNG file in the of %LOCALAPPDATA%\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\.

Has there been any updates on this?

Thanks.
creator: ACZano

title: userChrome.css code
content:
/* Keep site icon visible on hover */ .tabbrowser-tab:hover .tab-icon-stack:not([pinned], [sharing], [crashed]):is([soundplaying], [muted]) > :not(.tab-icon-overlay), 

    /* for site icon with Compact density */
root[uidensity="compact"] .tab-icon-stack:not([pinned], [sharing], [crashed]):is([soundplaying], [muted]) > :not(.tab-icon-overlay) { 
   opacity: 1 !important; /* overrides full transparency with full opacity */

}


i want this userChrome.css code to be modified to always work, not only when hover overing the mouse.
creator: moderndefender

title: Download fails almost immediately (No error message after a few tries)
content:
Initially I would get the error message '...part could not be saved, because the source file could not be read. Try again later, or contact the server administrator'. After repeated download attempts, now all I get is just 'failed'.

There are no problems downloading with latest versions of Chrome and Edge (without disabling anti-virus or extensions). Have actually tried most of what wormmulch did except for safe mode. [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1294366]

Tried the following for Firefox 97: 1) Disabled add-ons and anti-virus. 2) Refreshed and finally reinstalled as a last resort.

Decided to try Download Manager (S3) from the add-ons page and the download was completed without any noticeable glitches. Clicking on the website's download button would result in a failed download and using 'save link as' would give a successful download using the download manager.

Hope someone can help identify and troubleshoot underlying issues(s). Thank you in advance.
creator: FxMoz

title: Cannot use Pen Tablet as Mouse
content:
Recently updated my Firefox Browser to the latest version as of this posting.

Now however, even with Windows 10's setting "Let me use my pen as a mouse in some desktop apps" checked to on, my Wacom Intuos can only scroll and no longer highlight or drag links and images. This is really inconvenient to me as I prefer the mouse setting for pen tablets retained when using a browser.

Would appreciate any input on what can be done.
creator: FlippinPhil

title: Firefox will not work
content: Last night my firefox stopped working. Any time I used a bookmark or typed in a website, it would start to load and just sit at a blank screen continuing to load but not doing anything. I checked in another browser and it worked just fine, so it’s not my internet. I’ve tried closing and re-opening firefox, any time I open it now it says it’s already running and I need to close the previous session. I have tried un-installing and re-installing firefox, clearing my history and cookie cache, and restarting my laptop multiple times but nothing is working. I would appreciate any help with this, thank you.
creator: zsromisher

title: Mozilla Firefox no longer starts on Window 10 Desktop
content:
I have used Firefox on this Windows 10 desktop computer for at least 6 months with no problems. I have it set as my default browser.

When I say it "does not start" I mean the hourglass is shown for a few seconds, then nothing. Task Manager does not show Firefox running.

Since about 5 days ago it will not start when I click its icon on my taskbar or when I click on a link in an email. Both of these used to work. I have also typed Firefox into the Windows search box and clicked the icon then shown, but it does not start.

I have googled the problem and tried a number of things, such as re-installing.

When I do Windows-button & R to get the Run box, enter “firefox.exe -P” and click OK, the profile program does not start.

When I run "Firefox Installer.exe" it goes through process and ends with Firefox open. That is how I was able to get in to get the Troubleshooting Information. However, I do not want to start it this way all the time, and it would not work on links in emails.

I could not find how to add Tags.

Thanks.
creator: LarsB

title: Increasing incompatibility with web sites I encounter
content:
In the last several months, I am encountering more and more websites where Firefox doesn't work and Chrome does (I rarely use the Microsoft offerings, so I haven't been testing them).

One example is https://shop.revopoint3d.com/products/pop2-3d-scanner . If you go there with Firefox, clicking on the 'Premium' button near the top right does not result in the price updating. I don't have this problem with Chrome.

Another example is the AMC Stubs site where I was unable to purchase a membership after several attempts (including rebooting my system). Did it with Chrome in moments. However, once I created the account using Chrome, I can now log in using Firefox.

Yet another example is the Vanguard site (investments) where I have not been able to log in using Firefox for the last few months (had done it for years before this): https://investor.vanguard.com/home . The site just ignores any clicks I make.

So... what could be causing this?
creator: jrlind55

title: Sign-in URL doesn't work with my password
content:
Greetings. I erased part of the URL that my password manager uses to let me log into Foxfire. This is what's left: https://accounts.firefox.com/oauth/signin?response_type=code&scope=openid Please see the added image below for the error page/message I now land on. I don't need to get to my account page. I know how to access that from the "hamburger" I'm want the URL that would show up after I had created account and set my username and password. . If possible can you send me something that I can cut and paste into the address window in my password manager? Also my password and email still work. But the only other URLs that will let me in with them is the landing page for Pocket and the Mozilla Help page.

Thanks!
